metadata.name: Gaur
metadata.description:
Gaur are the largest cattle species in the world and one of the largest living land mammals. The global population of these water buffaloes, is less than 4000, of which about 2900 live in India. 

From the series "Endangered" - a collection of hand-painted artworks about the disappearing wildlife from India, created using old toothbrushes as the main tool.

Medium - Acrylic paint on paper 
Size - 8.4” x 11.7”
 Format - PNG
